siteMetadata.title: IFT Docs
siteMetadata.description: A guide to IFT's standards and APIs

frontmatter.title: Business Steps
frontmatter.description: This covers all the additional Business Steps added by GDST to cover specific event scenarios in Seafood Traceability.

children.value: Business Steps were extended to cover the recording of events not covered in the EPCIS CBV 1.2 standard. These events cover scenarios unique to Seafood Traceability. The business steps are recorded under the namespace
Products are harvested from the wild.
A fishing vessel catches some Tuna from the ocean.
Products are harvested from an aquaculture facility.
A shrimp farmer harvests shrimp from a pong.
A product harvested from the wild is transferred to a
A Tuna is harvested by a fishing vessel an transferred to a tinger to be carried to shore.
A product harvested in the wild is transferred from a
for the first time since being harvested.
Tuna is offloaded from a tinder to a dock.
A feed is given to a live fish at an aquaculture facility. This is a
event with the input being the feed and the output is what is being fed.
A shrimp farmers feeds his shrimp.
A container at an aquaculture is stocked with a live species.
A shrimp farmer stocks his pond with shrimp.
A temperature is recorded about seafood products.
A cargo container of frozen shrimp is recorded for the cold-chain.
A processors packages salmon fillets into cedar planks inside cartons.
Products are put together without their GTIN changing. Only the Lot Number changes.
Caviar collected from several fisherman is collected into a barrel to be processed.
Products are sampled and scientific measurements are recording as part of the event.
A biological test is performed on salmon and the results of the test are recorded with the event.
A Shrimp Processor block freezes a case of shrimp.

pages.title: How to Use this Documentation
pages.description: This is a quick guide on how we hope people to use this documentation.

pages.title: Why EPCIS?
pages.description: Here is page that covers why we chose EPCIS as the interoperable data format standard.

pages.title: Master Data
pages.description: This page contains example master data that is used in events recorded for products harvested from the wild.

pages.title: Feeding
pages.description: Covers event data that is recorded around the feeding of products while they are being grown at an aquaculture facility.

pages.title: Wild to Farmed
pages.description: This covers scenarios where products are harvested from the wild to stock an aquaculture facility. Then those products are harvested from the aquaculture facility when they are ready for commerical use.

pages.title: Commodities
pages.description: How to handle the different scenarios across the diverse amount of commodities.

pages.title: Master Data
pages.description: This page contains example master data that is used in events recorded for products harvested from the wild.

pages.title: Fishing Event
pages.description: This page covers information about capturing the Fishing / Wild Harvest event.

pages.title: On Vessel Processing
pages.description: This page covers information about capturing events in regards to On-Vessel Processing.

pages.description: How to record the Landing events given different scenarios.

pages.description: How to record the Landing events given different scenarios.

pages.description: This covers how the ILMD attributes have been extended to support the needs to of Seafood Traceability.

pages.description: This covers how the Object Event type has been extended to support Seafood Traceability.
